Activities

Erehwon has been very active in the Philippine art scene since its conception. Aside from hosting events and housing exhibitions, the foundation also offers workshops and lectures occasionally.

Exhibition Schedules

The Erehwon Art Center is open to visitors from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM, and on Saturdays by appointment only.

Gallery

Irony

UP College of Fine Arts
Erehwon Art Center

Irony was an exhibit in May 2016 of metal sculptures by students of the UP College of Fine Arts, featuring the ironic marriage of organic forms and industrial materials.

Read More

Platform

UP College of Fine Arts
Erehwon Art Center

Platform was a group exhibit by the students of the UP College of Fine Arts in March 2016.

Read More

Pumapapel

Various Artists
Erehwon Art Center 3/F Gallery 1

Pumapapel was a group show in February 2015 that made use of paper as its main medium. The artists created two- and three-dimensional pieces from small to big formats.

Read More

Amazing F

Various Artists
Erehwon Art Center 3/F Gallery 1

Amazing F was conceived to pay homage to women in celebration of International Women’s Month. The artworks focused on women’s issues such as inequality, domesticity, woman as healer and nurturer, and woman as exploited object.

Read More

Art and Anthropology

Various Artists
Erehwon Art Center 3/F Gallery 1

Art and Anthropology: Portrait of the Object as Filipino is a project of Dr. Almira Gilles of the Field Museum of Natural History in Chicago. Two huge paintings were created through the interaction of 5 Filipino American artists from Chicago and 5 Filipino artists from the Philippines.

Read More
